example_1: dānañ'ca dhammacariyā ca, ñātakānañ'ca saṅgaho. anavajjāni kammāni, etam'maṅgalam'uttamaṃ.
example_2: sīlabbataṃ vā'pi pahāya sabbaṃ, kammañ'ca sāvajj'anavajjam'etaṃ, suddhiṃ asuddhin'ti apatthayāno, virato care santim'anuggahāya.
example_3: so iminā ariyena sīlakkhandhena samannāgato ajjhattaṃ anavajjasukhaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti
example_4: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi aṅgehi samannāgatā vācā subhāsitā hoti, no dubbhāsitā, anavajjā ca ananuvajjā ca viññūnan'ti.

example_1: yan'dunnimittaṃ avamaṅgalañ'ca, yo c'āmanāpo sakuṇassa saddo, pāpaggaho dussupinaṃ akantaṃ, buddh'ānubhāvena vināsam'entu
example_2: pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato thero bhikkhu sabrahmacārīnaṃ appiyo ca hoti amanāpo ca agaru ca abhāvanīyo ca
example_3: duruttānaṃ durāgatānaṃ vacanapathānaṃ, uppannānaṃ sārīrikānaṃ vedanānaṃ dukkhānaṃ tippānaṃ kharānaṃ kaṭukānaṃ asātānaṃ amanāpānaṃ pāṇaharānaṃ adhivāsakajātiko hoti
example_4: idha yassa te honti aniṭṭhā akantā amanāpā rūpā saddā gandhā rasā phoṭṭhabbā dhammā, ye vā panassa te honti anatthakāmā ahitakāmā aphāsukakāmā ayogakkhemakāmā

meaning: dissatisfaction; dislike; discontent; aversion; boredom listlessness
example_1: muditaṃ, rāhula, bhāvanaṃ bhāvehi. muditañ'hi te, rāhula, bhāvanaṃ bhāvayato yā arati sā pahīyissati.
example_2: paññaṃ purakkhatvā kalyāṇapīti, vikkhambhaye tāni parissayāni, aratiṃ sahetha sayanamhi pante, caturo sahetha paridevadhamme.
example_3: yena anuppannaṃ vā thīnamiddhaṃ uppajjati uppannaṃ vā thinamiddhaṃ bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattati yatha'y'idaṃ arati tandī vijambhitā bhattasammado cetaso ca līnattaṃ.

example_1: seyyathā'pi, rāhula, rañño nāgo īsādanto urūḷhavā abhijāto saṅgāma-avacaro saṅgāmagato purimehi'pi pādehi kammaṃ karoti, pacchimehi'pi pādehi kammaṃ karoti
example_2: yato ca kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu saddho ca hoti, sīlavā ca, bahussuto ca, dhammakathiko ca, parisā-avacaro ca, visārado ca parisāya dhammaṃ deseti … evaṃ so ten'aṅgena paripūro hoti.

example_1: tassa evaṃ jānato evaṃ passato kām'āsavā'pi cittaṃ vimuccati bhav'āsavā'pi cittaṃ vimuccati avijj'āsavā'pi cittaṃ vimuccati
example_2: tayo'me, bhikkhave, āsavā, kām'āsavo, bhav'āsavo, avijj'āsavo.
example_3: yassa dhamme manasikaroto anuppanno vā avijj'āsavo na uppajjati, uppanno vā avijj'āsavo pahīyati

meaning: arousing energy; making an effort; initiative
example_1: vīriya-arambhāya saṃvattanti, no kosajjāya, subharatāya saṃvattanti, no dubbharatāyā
example_2: n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammam'pi samanupassāmi yena anuppannaṃ vā thinamiddhaṃ n'uppajjati uppannaṃ vā thinamiddhaṃ pahīyati yatha'y'idaṃ, bhikkhave, ārambhadhātu nikkamadhātu parakkamadhātu

example_1: n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammam'pi samanupassāmi yena anuppannaṃ vā thinamiddhaṃ n'uppajjati uppannaṃ vā thinamiddhaṃ pahīyati yatha'y'idaṃ, bhikkhave, ārambhadhātu nikkamadhātu parakkamadhātu

meaning: control of the mind; sense restraint
example_1: so iminā ca ariyena sīlakkhandhena samannāgato, imāya ca ariyāya santuṭṭhiyā samannāgato, iminā ca ariyena indriyasaṃvarena samannāgato, iminā ca ariyena satisampajaññena samannāgato vivittaṃ sen'āsanaṃ bhajiṃ
example_2: tīṇi'p'āhaṃ sucaritāni sāhārāni vadāmi, no anāhārāni. ko c'āhāro tiṇṇaṃ sucaritānaṃ? indriyasaṃvaro'ti'ssa vacanīyaṃ.
example_3: kalyāṇamittatā sīlānaṃ āhāro, indriyasaṃvaro brahmacariyassa āhāro, avisaṃvādanā mittānaṃ āhāro

example_1: te bhikkhū bhikkhūhi evam'assu vacanīyā, m'āyasmanto evaṃ avacuttha, na c'eso bhikkhu dhammavādī, na c'eso bhikkhu vinayavādī, m'āyasmantānam'pi saṅghabhedo ruccittha

ye'pi te, bho gotama, samaṇabrāhmaṇā saṅghino gaṇino gaṇācariyā ñātā yasassino titthakarā sādhusammatā bahujanassa, seyyath'idaṃ, pūraṇo kassapo, makkhali gosālo, nigaṇṭho nāṭaputto, sañcayo belaṭṭhaputto, pakudho kaccāyano, ajito kesakambalo
example_2: abhijānām'ahaṃ, bho gotama, pūraṇaṃ kassapaṃ vādena vādaṃ samārabhitā. so'pi mayā vādena vādaṃ samāraddho aññen'aññaṃ paṭicari, bahiddhā kathaṃ apanāmesi, kopañ'ca dosañ'ca appaccayañ'ca pātvākāsi.
example_3: āyasmatā ca sāriputtena āyasmatā ca mahāmoggallānena āyasmatā ca mahākassapena āyasmatā ca mahākaccāyanena āyasmatā ca mahākoṭṭhikena āyasmatā ca mahākappinena
example_4: suṇāti na vijānāti, āloketi na passati. dhammasmiṃ bhaññamānasmiṃ, atthaṃ bālo na bujjhati. sace'pi dasa pajjote, dhārayissasi, kassapa. n'eva dakkhati rūpāni, cakkhu hi'ssa na vijjatī'ti.

meaning: interest in sensual pleasure; sensual desire (for); sensual impulse (for)
example_1: kāmacchando ca byāpādo, thinamiddhañ'ca bhikkhuno, uddhaccaṃ vicikicchā ca, pañc'ete cittakelisā.
example_2: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu santaṃ vā ajjhattaṃ kāmacchandaṃ, atthi me ajjhattaṃ kāmacchando'ti pajānāti, asantaṃ vā ajjhattaṃ kāmacchandaṃ, n'atthi me ajjhattaṃ kāmacchando'ti pajānāti
example_3: evam'eva kho, ye hi keci samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā kāyena c'eva cittena ca kāmehi avūpakaṭṭhā viharanti, yo ca n'esaṃ kāmesu kāmacchando kāmasneho kāmamucchā kāmapipāsā kāmapariḷāho

meaning: effluent of sensual pleasure; oozing sensual desire
example_1: tassa evaṃ jānato evaṃ passato kām'āsavā'pi cittaṃ vimuccati bhav'āsavā'pi cittaṃ vimuccati avijj'āsavā'pi cittaṃ vimuccati
example_2: tayo'me, bhikkhave, āsavā, kām'āsavo, bhav'āsavo, avijj'āsavo.
example_3: yassa dhamme manasikaroto anuppanno vā kām'āsavo na uppajjati, uppanno vā kāmāsavo pahīyati

example_1: pahoti c'āyasmā ānando imassa bhagavatā saṃkhittena uddesassa uddiṭṭhassa vitthārena atthaṃ avibhattassa vitthārena atthaṃ vibhajituṃ.

n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammam'pi samanupassāmi yena anuppannaṃ vā thīnamiddhaṃ uppajjati uppannaṃ vā thinamiddhaṃ bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattati yatha'y'idaṃ, bhikkhave, arati tandī vijambhikā bhattasammado cetaso ca līnattaṃ
example_2: niddaṃ tandiṃ vijambhitaṃ, aratiṃ bhattasammadaṃ, vīriyena naṃ paṇāmetvā, ariyamaggo visujjhatī'ti.

example_1: so rūpaṃ viññāṇaṃ upeti upādiyati adhiṭṭhāti attā me'ti. tass'ime pañc'upādānakkhandhā upetā upādinnā dīgharattaṃ ahitāya dukkhāya saṃvattanti.
example_2: tass'ime dhammā aññam'aññaṃ vipaccanīkā gahitā dīgharattaṃ ahitāya dukkhāya saṃvattanti kodh'ābhibhūtassa.

example_1: mal'itthiyā duccaritaṃ, maccheraṃ dadato malaṃ, malā ve pāpakā dhammā, asmiṃ loke paramhi ca.
example_2: ye ca kho keci kāyena duccaritaṃ caranti vācāya duccaritaṃ caranti manasā duccaritaṃ caranti tesaṃ appiyo attā
example_3: pañca'p'āhaṃ nīvaraṇe sāhāre vadāmi, no anāhāre. ko c'āhāro pañcannaṃ nīvaraṇānaṃ? tīṇi duccaritānī'ti'ssa vacanīyaṃ.

meaning: principle of endurance; element of persistence; (comm) stronger effort
example_1: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, brāhmaṇa, atthi ārabbhadhātu ... atthi nikkamadhātu ... atthi parakkamadhātu... atthi thāmadhātu... atthi ṭhitidhātu... atthi upakkamadhātū'ti? evaṃ, bho.
example_2: n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammam'pi samanupassāmi yena anuppannaṃ vā thinamiddhaṃ n'uppajjati uppannaṃ vā thinamiddhaṃ pahīyati yatha'y'idaṃ, bhikkhave, ārambhadhātu nikkamadhātu parakkamadhātu

meaning: based on ending; supported by cessation; by means of finishing
example_1: kathaṃ bhāvitā ca, bhikkhave, satta bojjh'aṅgā kathaṃ bahulīkatā vijjāvimuttiṃ paripūrenti ? idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu satisambojjh'aṅgaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ.
bhikkhu pan'eva dubbacajātiko hoti uddesapariyāpannesu sikkhāpadesu bhikkhūhi sahadhammikaṃ vuccamāno attānaṃ avacanīyaṃ karoti
example_2: niṭṭhitacīvarasmiṃ bhikkhunā ubbhatasmiṃ kathine bhikkhuno pan'eva akālacīvaraṃ uppajjeyya, ākaṅkhamānena bhikkhunā paṭiggahetabbaṃ, paṭiggahetvā khippam'eva kāretabbaṃ

example_1: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, brāhmaṇa, atthi ārabbhadhātu ... atthi nikkamadhātu ... atthi parakkamadhātu... atthi thāmadhātu... atthi ṭhitidhātu... atthi upakkamadhātū'ti? evaṃ, bho.
example_2: n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammam'pi samanupassāmi yena anuppannaṃ vā thinamiddhaṃ n'uppajjati uppannaṃ vā thinamiddhaṃ pahīyati yatha'y'idaṃ, bhikkhave, ārambhadhātu nikkamadhātu parakkamadhātu

meaning: developing (into); ripening (in); culminating (in); maturing (in); inclining towards
example_1: katame ca, bhikkhave, āsavā bhāvanā pahātabbā? idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu paṭisaṅkhā yoniso satisambojjh'aṅgaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ
atha kho tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ etadahosi, atippago kho tāva sāvatthiyaṃ piṇḍāya carituṃ, yaṃ nūna mayaṃ yena aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ ārāmo ten'upasaṅkameyyāmā'ti
example_2: sace, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyā paribbājakā evaṃ puccheyyuṃ, kiṃmūlakā, āvuso, sabbe dhammā, kiṃsambhavā sabbe dhammā, kiṃsamudayā sabbe dhammā, kiṃsamosaraṇā sabbe dhammā
example_3: yo pana bhikkhu acelakassa vā paribbājakassa vā paribbājikāya vā sahatthā khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā dadeyya, pācittiyaṃ.

example_1: tassa papaṭikā'pi pāripūriṃ gacchati taco'pi pheggu'pi sāro'pi pāripūriṃ gacchati
example_2: aṭṭh'ime, bhikkhave, hetū aṭṭha paccayā ādibrahmacariyikāya paññāya appaṭiladdhāya paṭilābhāya, paṭiladdhāya bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya bhāvanāya pāripūriyā saṃvattanti. katame aṭṭha?

meaning: drowsiness after eating; passing out after eating
example_1: n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammam'pi samanupassāmi yena anuppannaṃ vā thīnamiddhaṃ uppajjati uppannaṃ vā thinamiddhaṃ bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattati yatha'y'idaṃ, bhikkhave, arati tandī vijambhikā bhattasammado cetaso ca līnattaṃ
example_2: niddā tandī vijambhitā, aratī bhattasammado, etena nappakāsati, ariyamaggo idha pāṇinan'ti.

meaning: effluent of becoming; effluent of being
example_1: tassa evaṃ jānato evaṃ passato kām'āsavā'pi cittaṃ vimuccati bhav'āsavā'pi cittaṃ vimuccati avijj'āsavā'pi cittaṃ vimuccati
example_2: tayo'me, bhikkhave, āsavā, kām'āsavo, bhav'āsavo, avijj'āsavo.
example_3: yassa dhamme manasikaroto anuppanno vā bhav'āsavo na uppajjati, uppanno vā bhav'āsavo pahīyati.

meaning: maturity by development; completion by cultivation; full development by meditation

example_1: sīle patiṭṭhāya naro sapañño, cittaṃ paññañ'ca bhāvayaṃ, ātāpī nipako bhikkhu, so imaṃ vijaṭaye jaṭaṃ.
example_2: so taṃ maggaṃ āsevati bhāveti bahulīkaroti. tassa taṃ maggaṃ āsevato bhāvayato bahulīkaroto saṃyojanāni sabbaso pahīyanti anusayā byantīhonti.
example_3: yañ'hi'ssa, bhikkhave, abhāvayato uppajjeyyuṃ āsavā vighātapariḷāhā, bhāvayato evaṃsa te āsavā vighātapariḷāhā na honti.

example_1: kuḍḍamūlañ'ca nissāya, ālopaṃ taṃ abhuñjisaṃ, bhuñjamāne vā bhutte vā, jegucchaṃ me na vijjati.
example_2: na khv'āhaṃ taṃ, brāhmaṇa, passāmi sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya, yassa so pāyaso bhutto sammā pariṇāmaṃ gaccheyya, aññatra tathāgatassa vā tathāgatasāvakassa vā.
example_3: seyyo ayoguḷo bhutto, tatto aggisikh'ūpamo, yañ'ce bhuñjeyya dussīlo, raṭṭhapiṇḍam'asaññato.
example_4: upakkhalitvā vā papateyyaṃ, bhattaṃ vā me bhuttaṃ byāpajjeyya, pittaṃ vā me kuppeyya, semhaṃ vā me kuppeyya, satthakā vā me vātā kuppeyyuṃ

meaning: name of an arahant monk; great disciple of the Buddha; foremost disciple in preaching ascetic practices
example_1: āyasmatā ca sāriputtena āyasmatā ca mahāmoggallānena āyasmatā ca mahākassapena āyasmatā ca mahākaccāyanena āyasmatā ca mahākoṭṭhikena āyasmatā ca mahākappinena
example_2: atha kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno sāy'anhasamayaṃ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito yen'āyasmā mahākassapo ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ mahākassapaṃ etadavoca, āyām'āvuso, kassapa, yen'āyasmā sāriputto ten'upasaṅkamissāma dhammassavanāyā'ti.
example_3: atha kho āyasmā mahākassapo āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ etadavoca, kiṃ nu kho, āvuso ānanda, ahaṃ sūcivāṇijako, tvaṃ sūcikāro, udāhu ahaṃ sūcikāro, tvaṃ sūcivāṇijako'ti?

example_1: pañc'ime, bhikkhave, ādīnavā dantakaṭṭhassa akhādane. katame pañca? acakkhussaṃ, mukhaṃ duggandhaṃ hoti, rasaharaṇiyo na visujjhanti, pittaṃ semhaṃ bhattaṃ pariyonandhati, bhattam'assa nacchādeti.
example_2: yo nindiyaṃ pasaṃsati, taṃ vā nindati yo pasaṃsiyo vicināti mukhena so kaliṃ, kalinā tena sukhaṃ na vindati.
example_3: tassa mukh'ādhāne kāraṇaṃ kāriyamānassa honti y'eva visūkāyitāni visevitāni vipphanditāni kānici kānici, yathā taṃ akāritapubbaṃ kāraṇaṃ kāriyamānassa.
example_4: yo pana bhikkhu adinnaṃ mukhadvāraṃ āhāraṃ āhareyya, aññatra udakadantaponā, pācittiyaṃ.

meaning: radical attention; paying proper attention; prudently applying the mind; wise reflection; focussed attention; attention to the source
example_1: n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammam'pi samanupassāmi yena anuppannā vā vicikicchā n'uppajjati uppannā vā vicikicchā pahīyati yatha'y'idaṃ, bhikkhave, yonisomanasikāro
example_2: yonisomanasikāram'p'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, sāhāraṃ vadāmi, no anāhāraṃ. ko c'āhāro yonisomanasikārassa? saddhā'ti'ssa vacanīyaṃ.

meaning: stability of mind as an element of awakening; mental composure as a factor of enlightenment
example_1: paṭisaṅkhā yoniso samādhisambojjh'aṅgaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ.
kodhasammadasammatto, āyasakyaṃ nigacchati, ñātimittā suhajjā ca, parivajjanti kodhanaṃ.
example_2: yena anuppannaṃ vā thīnamiddhaṃ uppajjati uppannaṃ vā thinamiddhaṃ bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattati yatha'y'idaṃ arati tandī vijambhitā bhattasammado cetaso ca līnattaṃ.

example_1: kāyappakopaṃ rakkheyya, kāyena saṃvuto siyā, kāyaduccaritaṃ hitvā, kāyena sucaritaṃ care.
anattani, bhikkhave, attā'ti saññāvipallāso cittavipallāso diṭṭhivipallāso. asubhe, bhikkhave, subhan'ti saññāvipallāso cittavipallāso diṭṭhivipallāso.
example_2: seyyathā'pi nāma maṇi veḷuriyo subho jātimā aṭṭh'aṃso suparikammakato paṇḍukambale nikkhitto bhāsate ca tapate ca virocati ca
example_3: n'āhaṃ aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yena anuppanno vā kāmacchando uppajjati uppanno vā kāmacchando bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattati yatha'y'idaṃ subhanimittaṃ.

meaning: thoroughly freed; correctly liberated; perfectly emancipated
example_1: ye ca kho keci, bhikkhave, samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā ... rūpassa nibbidā virāgā nirodhā anupādā vimuttā, te suvimuttā. ye suvimuttā, te kevalino. ye kevalino vaṭṭaṃ tesaṃ n'atthi paññāpanāya.
example_2: etesu dhammesu vineyya chandaṃ, bhikkhu satimā suvimuttacitto, kālena so sammā dhammaṃ parivīmaṃsamāno, ekodibhūto vihane tamaṃ so'ti.
example_3: rūpadhātuyā kho yo chando yo rāgo yā nandī yā taṇhā ye upay'upādānā cetaso adhiṭṭhān'ābhinives'ānusayā, tesaṃ khayā virāgā nirodhā cāgā paṭinissaggā cittaṃ suvimuttan'ti vuccati.
example_4: imasmiñ'ca saviññāṇake kāye bahiddhā ca sabbanimittesu ahaṅ'kāramamaṅ'kāramān'āpagataṃ mānasaṃ hoti vidhā samatikkantaṃ santaṃ suvimuttan'ti.

meaning: should be spoken (to); should be told (to); should be said (to)
example_1: ye manussā pubbe'pi vassikasāṭikacīvaraṃ denti te upasaṅkamitvā evam'assu vacanīyā, kālo vassikasāṭikāya, samayo vassikasāṭikāya, aññe'pi manussā vassikasāṭikacīvaraṃ dentī'ti.
example_2: tādisikāya āpattiyā ekaccaṃ pabbājenti ekaccaṃ na pabbājentī'ti, so bhikkhu bhikkhūhi evam'assa vacanīyo

example_1: idha bhikkhave bhikkhuno mettaṃ kāyakammaṃ vacīkammaṃ manokammaṃ paccupaṭṭhitaṃ hoti sabrahmacārīsu āvi c'eva raho ca
example_2: seyyathā'pi rañño paccantime nagare anupariyāyapatho hoti ucco c'eva vitthato ca, evam'evaṃ kho, ariyasāvako ottappī hoti, ottappati kāyaduccaritena vacīduccaritena manoduccaritena
example_3: codakena bhikkhunā paraṃ codetu'kāmena evaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ, parisuddhakāyasamācāro nu kho'mhi?parisuddhavacīsamācāro nu kho'mhi?

example_1: saccaṃ vihāya matisaccakavādaketuṃ, vād'ābhiropitamanaṃ atiandhabhūtaṃ, paññāpadīpajalito jitavā mun'indo
example_2: vadanti ve duṭṭhamanā'pi eke, atho'pi ve saccamanā vadanti, vādañ'ca jātaṃ muni no upeti, tasmā munī n'atthi khilo kuhiñci.
example_3: na'y'idaṃ, bhikkhave, brahmacariyaṃ vussati janakuhan'atthaṃ, na janalapan'atthaṃ, na lābhasakkārasilok'ānisaṃs'atthaṃ, na itivādappamokkh'ānisaṃs'atthaṃ, na iti maṃ jano jānātū'ti
example_4: saccan'ti so brāhmaṇo kiṃ vadeyya, musā'ti vā so vivadetha kena, yasmiṃ samaṃ visamaṃ vā'pi n'atthi, sa kena vādaṃ paṭisaṃyujeyya.

example_1: bojjh'aṅgo satisaṅkhāto dhammānaṃ vicayo tathā viriyam'pītipassaddhi bojjh'aṅgā ca tathā'pare samādh'upekkhabojjh'aṅgā.
example_2: santaṃ vā ajjhattaṃ dhammavicayasambojjh'aṅgaṃ, atthi me ajjhattaṃ dhammavicayasambojjh'aṅgo'ti pajānāti

example_1: yena anuppannaṃ vā thīnamiddhaṃ uppajjati uppannaṃ vā thinamiddhaṃ bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattati yatha'y'idaṃ arati tandī vijambhitā bhattasammado cetaso ca līnattaṃ.

meaning: based on fading of desire; supported by dispassion; by means of detachment
example_1: kathaṃ bhāvitā ca, bhikkhave, satta bojjh'aṅgā kathaṃ bahulīkatā vijjāvimuttiṃ paripūrenti ? idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu satisambojjh'aṅgaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ.

meaning: based on seclusion; supported by detachment; by means of disengagement
example_1: kathaṃ bhāvitā ca, bhikkhave, satta bojjh'aṅgā kathaṃ bahulīkatā vijjāvimuttiṃ paripūrenti ? idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu satisambojjh'aṅgaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ.
atha kho āyasmato girimānandassa dasa saññā sutvā so ābādho ṭhānaso paṭippassambhi. vuṭṭhahi c'āyasmā girimānando tamhā ābādhā. tathā pahīno ca pan'āyasmato girimānandassa so ābādho ahosī'ti.

meaning: complete relinquishment; release; letting go; giving up
example_1: katame ca, bhikkhave, āsavā bhāvanā pahātabbā? idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu paṭisaṅkhā yoniso satisambojjh'aṅgaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ
example_2: saddhassa hi, bhante, ariyasāvakassa āraddhavīriyassa upaṭṭhitassatino etaṃ pāṭikaṅkhaṃ yaṃ vossagg'ārammaṇaṃ karitvā labhissati samādhiṃ, labhissati cittassa ek'aggataṃ.

meaning: developing into complete relinquishment; ripening in release; culminating in letting go
example_1: kathaṃ bhāvitā ca, bhikkhave, satta bojjh'aṅgā kathaṃ bahulīkatā vijjāvimuttiṃ paripūrenti ? idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu satisambojjh'aṅgaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ.
